resources.string: This app sends information from the controller — joystick positions and button states — to a device over WIFI using the UDP protocol.
[Destination IP] and [Send Port] in the settings represent the address (IP and Port #) to which the controller packets should be sent.
The packets — once decoded to text by the receiving device — are as follows, where the numbers are of course dynamic:
This is the text equivalent of a Python dictionary, and can be converted with ast.literal_eval in Python, and regex in other languages.

Button values (btn…) are 0 when off and 1 when on. Touchpad values (…TouchPad…) range from -100 to 100 in both the X (horizontal) direction and the Y (vertical) direction. The last three buttons are toggles.
Telemetry can also be displayed in the top portion of the controller view. The app will scale the text size to fit in all the received telemetry data.
[Receive Port] is the port on which this phone will be listening for telemetry data in the form of UDP packets.
Telemetry info will update as fast as it is received. The frequency at which the controller packets are sent is also configurable:
[Update Frequency] is the frequency, in hertz, at which the UDP packets should be sent.
This app is open source! See github.com/cameronfr/RobotRemote for examples and code. Please rate and leave feedback; I will get back to you as soon as possible if you arere having any issues.
